I can guide you through your higher studies. What was your stream in class 12 ?
If you are interested in careers in engineering, medical can choose this track. You can select from a variety of courses such as B.Tech, MBBS, BSc., and so on.

Joint Entrance Examination (JEE): JEE is a national level entrance exam conducted by the National Testing Agency (NTA) for admission to undergraduate engineering courses in Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs), National Institutes of Technology (NITs), and other top engineering colleges. State-Level Entrance Exams: Each state in India conducts its own engineering entrance exams for admission to state-level engineering colleges.

patterns: What are the various Medical exam
responses: National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET): NEET is a national-level entrance exam conducted by the National Testing Agency (NTA) for admission to undergraduate medical courses in Indian medical colleges

patterns: What are the BSC exams Conducted
responses: Indian Institutes of Science Education and Research (IISER) Aptitude Test: IISER Aptitude Test is a national level entrance exam conducted for admission to undergraduate science courses at Indian Institutes of Science Education and Research (IISER). State-Level Entrance Exams: Each state in India conducts its own science entrance exams for admission to state-level science colleges. Also it depends on class 12 marks. This may varies college to college
Students who are interested in the business and finance field can opt for this stream. They can choose courses like B.Com, BBA, CA, CS, CMA, etc.

Chartered Accountancy (CA) Exam: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) conducts the CA Exam for admission to the Chartered Accountancy course.BCom course is the gateway to job opportunities in several fields such as Accounting, Finance, Economics, Taxation, Insurance, etc. One can become an Accountant, Financial Analyst, Auditor, etc. after graduating with a BCom degree. This degree is also beneficial to those students who want to run their own businesses.Company Secretary (CS) Exam: The Institute of Company Secretaries of India (ICSI) conducts the CS Exam for admission to the Company Secretary course.
Students who are interested in pursuing careers in humanities, social sciences, or creative fields can opt for this stream. They can choose from courses like BA, BFA, B.Des, etc.

CLAT is a national-level entrance exam conducted by the Consortium of National Law Universities for admission to undergraduate and postgraduate law courses in India.JNUEE is a university-level entrance exam conducted by Jawaharlal Nehru University for admission to undergraduate and postgraduate courses in various fields including arts, science, and social sciences. DUET is a university-level entrance exam conducted by the University of Delhi for admission to undergraduate and postgraduate courses in various fields including arts, commerce, science, and law.

Students who are interested in acquiring skills related to various trades can opt for vocational courses. These courses include diploma and certificate courses in various fields like hospitality, tourism, fashion design, etc.
